a1: Keyword density is the percentage of times a keyword appears in your text relative to the total word count. It helps measure how focused your content is on specific topics.
q2: What is a good keyword density?
a2: A good keyword density is typically between 1-3% for primary keywords. Higher density may be seen as keyword stuffing by search engines.
a3: N-grams are phrases of N consecutive words. Bigrams are 2-word phrases and trigrams are 3-word phrases. Analyzing n-grams helps find important keyword phrases in your content.
